titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1826 Oct. 26 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1826 Oct. 26
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This particular excerpt is from October 26, 1926, and takes count of two cases. In both cases, the plaintiffs were awarded money. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: October and November 1826
Thursday 26th.
div.p: The Court met according to adjournment

Mary Taylor
Ptf Plaintiff
vs
Thos. Thomas Fields & Co. Deft Company Defendant
The Court find for the Ptf thirty dollars and cost of suit. $1-80

Taylor Eldridge Ptf
vs
John Walker ? Dft
The Court find for the plaintiff 51,756 in and costs of Suit. Cost appeal--- $3. 10½ Recd The above Cost of three dollars 10½ Cents 2nd. Nov. November 1827 John Marks N.Y.
Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 9 Oclock. Execution issued 6th Nov. 1826
